Tyler Streeter wrote:

>Another big thing on my to-do list is a sense of
>sight.  The two main options I've thought of are
>these:
>
>1.  Ray-casting.  Shoot a grid of rays out from the
>face that each return the distance of the nearest
>intersection (i.e. distance sensors).  More rays could
>be added throughout evolution.  I've heard that such
>intersection testing in large quantities is pretty
>expensive if the environment is complex.
>
>  
>
Hi Tyler,

Keep in mind that sight's primary purpose is to allow the mind to build 
an internal model of physical surroundings. Within the computer there 
are far more efficient ways of providing this information to your 
artificial human's 'brain' since the surroundings are already described 
mathematically, so unless you were intending to transfer the whole 
project to a real-world scenario I see eye simulation as unnecessary.

It's really nice work so far though, actually I thought watching the CGI 
man falling over was kind of amusing as well :)

Regards,

Colin
